header.gameNote: SOUTHLAND CONF TR AT HOUSTON TX

article.headline: McNeese St. 77, Texas-Arlington 76
article.story: HOUSTON (AP) -- Jarvis Bradley scored 23 points and came up with a big steal with 11 seconds left to help give McNeese State a 77-76 win over Texas-Arlington in the first round of the Southland Conference tournament Thursday night. Bradley hit two free throws with 19 seconds left to give McNeese State a 76-73 lead. With Texas-Arlington attempting to set up for a 3-point shot, the 6-foot-6 Bradley stepped in front of a pass for a steal. McNeese State guard Troy Aaron was fouled with six seconds left on the possession and hitt one of two free throws to extend the Cowboys' lead to 77-73. Texas-Arlington's Rodrick Epps hit a 3-pointer with less than a second to play for the final margin. McNeese State (15-16) and seeded fourth in the tournament has won six of its last seven games and will play top-seed Texas A&M-Corpus Christi in the semifinals Friday. Aaron scored 16 points and Quentin Gonzales added 15 for McNeese State. Anthony Vereen scored 24 points and had 11 rebounds to lead Texas-Arlington, which had won eight of its last 11 games. Ro'ger Guignard added 18 and Jermaine Griffin came off the bench to score 10 for Texas-Arlington (13-17).

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
